result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert S. Estabrook was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert S. Estabrook is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert S. Estabrook was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert S. Estabrook

records.addlTxt: Letter from Judge to Defendant re: IID
Letter to Judge from Defendant re: IID

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation

9:40 a.m. Defendant Robert S. Estabrook in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin, along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 16cm96, 16ct16, 16cm111, 16cm104. State moves to dismiss 16cm111 and 16cm104- Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 16cm96 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea in 16ct16.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. State moves to amend Count 1 in 16cm96 to OWI-3rd - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Count. Court reiterates rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Finlan/Defendat/Court statement on sentencing.

Court Sentence
16ct16
WHS/POP - 2 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees/IID Surcharge/Blood Draw Surcharge
Fine - $1429 
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Conditional Jail - 5 days with Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before May 17, 2016
Driver's license revocation - 12 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Assessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

16cm96
WHS/POP - 2 years CC to 16ct16
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees/IID Surcharge/Blood Draw Surcharge
Fine - $1744
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Conditional Jail - 45 days, all but 14 days stayed with participation in OWI Treatment Court with Huber for all purposes. Consecutive to 16ct16. To commence on/before May 17, 2016
Driver's License revocation - 24 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Assessment
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Any jail credit pursuant to 973.155 to be agreed by written stipulation of parties. Defendant ordered to to report to probation prior to reporting to jail. 

Appeal rights given. 
Any cash bond to be applied to fines with balance to be refunded to poster. 

Adj. 10:11 a.m.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 17, 2016 at 09:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
for Attorney to Appear and Act

1:38 p.m. Attorney Patrick Howard Finlan in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm96 and 16cm107. Finlan files Authorization.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. In 15cm104 - Cash bond previously set retained with No intoxicants; no taverns provision - Finlan to return signed bond within 10 days. 
Bail continued. Adj. 1:40 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

01:23 p.m. Defendant Robert S. Estabrook in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $1100 cash bond. Adj. 1:28 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
